actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a one-time increase in the amount excludable from the sale of a principal residence by taxpayers who have attained age 50.

summary.text: Fair Taxes for Seniors Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a one-time increase ($500,000) in the exclusion of gain from the sale of a principal residence by a taxpayer who has attained the age of 50 before such sale. (States that in the case of a joint return only one spouse need satisfy the age requirement.)

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a one-time increase in the amount excludable from the sale of a principal residence by taxpayers who have attained age 50.
